title.narrative: Shelter Recovery And Reconstruction Coordination Support For Earthquake Affected Population In Nepal

description.narrative:
IOM and UN-Habitat have established a partnership to undertake the responsibility of co-chairing the RRWG and - from January 2015 onwards - the HRRP. The present project is to establish a sound coordination mechanism. This project will support the transition phase for the first 6 months, as the cluster and the RRWG are rolled into the HRRP in 2016.
The project will provide a platform for coordination, strategic planning, and technical guidance for agencies involved in longer term housing recovery and reconstruction, and to engage with the GoN and other key stakeholders to inform the wider housing reconstruction programme.Through the HRRP, UN-Habitat and IOM aim to:
Support government authorities (NAR, MOFALD, MOUD/DUDBC) in coordination, facilitating cooperation with the national and international organisations, the private sector, overseas labour migrants (remittances), and public associations engaged in housing recovery; Ensure consistent technical information is disseminated from the national level to district- and VDC-level actors; Support Information management to track housing recovery and reconstruction activities conducted by different agencies at national, district and VDC levels; Ensure timely and harmonized reporting from the field to the national level, including to donors and government partners.

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Shelter and housing recovery and reconstruction support provided by the POs are well coordinated among the partners and with the Government initiated rural housing recovery programme including agreed minimum standards for targeting and technical guidance provided to families

description.narrative: Shelter and housing recovery and reconstruction support provided by the POs are well coordinated among the partners and with the Government initiated rural housing recovery programme including agreed minimum standards for targeting and technical guidance provided to families

title.narrative: Policy support, communication, and common technical standards and capacity building of stakeholders support provided by HRRP widely utilised by the key stakeholders

description.narrative: Policy support, communication, and common technical standards and capacity building of stakeholders support provided by HRRP widely utilised by the key stakeholders

baseline.value: RRWG initiated and priority TWIGs agreed upon

target.value:
CSG/RRWG approved TWIGs guidance is endorsed by SAG/GoN and utilized by POs in reconstruction activities
Regular reports including maps, 4Ws and other IM tools demonstrate coordinated reconstruction activities that target the most vulnerable families with reconstruction technical assistance and support
HRRP continuity plan
